Title: Machine Learning Engineer (f/m/d)
HTML:
Intro

Exnaton is a startup, spun out of ETH Zurich, which offers software for renewable energy to utility companies. Our software enables energy providers to set up energy communities and smart energy tariffs in their distribution areas. Users of our software can track their energy consumption and buy renewable energy from their neighbors, which makes investing in the energy transition simple and fun!

Prosumers, dynamic electricity tariffs, and energy sharing are driving the energy transition and becoming integral components of the decentralized energy world. Our software is a cloud application that processes smart meter data and computes smart real-time prices for locally produced energy which makes renewable energy financially more attractive. End-users receive an app that maps the sources of their energy, making their electricity consumption more understandable.

Our team is growing and we are looking for extraordinary and talented people to complement our team. We are a diverse mix of engineers and business developers, all driven by the shared goal of using technology to create a sustainable impact in our society. If you're enthusiastic about contributing to this exciting journey, we invite you to be a part of our innovative and motivated team.

The job can be performed remotely in EU countries.

Your role

Responsibilities

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Exnaton, you will join our 25-person team and shape the company and its vision from the ground up. Among others, your main responsibilities are the following:

  • Contributing features to a state-of-the-art application for the energy sector and proposing new data-driven features that derive value from customers’ energy data (mostly time-series data);
  • Developing state-of-the-art machine-learning models for forecasting energy loads and prices, pattern recognition, and anomaly detection in energy data;
  • Contributing to our data pipelines and deployment setup for our models;
  • Collaborating closely with our software engineers to bridge the gap between the backend and analytical core of our product;
  • As we are planning to grow the team in the next few years, you will ideally support and mentor new colleagues and review the team’s models, code, and documentation in the future.

Your Qualifications

We define ourselves by a culture of collaboration and ownership. We’re looking for a driven, capable, and thoughtful person to add to our mission. We are looking for someone who:

  • Holds a degree in statistics, mathematics, physics, computer science or related field;
  • In-depth understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts behind most common machine learning techniques and time-series data;
  • Experience in coding and working with data using a wide range of tools and frameworks: Python, Pytorch, Tensorflow, Keras, Docker;
  • Ideally experience with cloud providers like AWS and frameworks like Docker and Kubernetes;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ideally in one or more of the following areas: machine learning for structured data, interpretable AI, uncertainty estimation, representation learning, or Bayesian deep learning;
  • Ability to see solutions and opportunities that others do not see;
  • Is a team player and thrives in a dynamic startup environment.

We would consider it a big plus if, besides working with data, you have an interest in renewable energy and sustainability. If you do not meet all of the above requirements but feel you would be a good match for our team do not hesitate to apply anyway.

Benefits

At Exnaton, you work in a dynamic environment with a flat hierarchy and direct communication, fostering quick operation and collaborative learning. You can also expect the following:

  • Competitive salary and equity package;
  • Flexible working hours and location as we believe in ownership and trust. We are a remote-first company and we support those working from different locations;
  • Additional benefits such as a new MacBook, a learning budget, sports membership, or Headspace subscription;
  • Virtual office for a truly interactive collaboration, even in a distributed team;
  • Working with exciting technology for a really important purpose, together with a highly motivated team.

About Us

Exnaton is a startup that offers software for renewable energy to energy companies. Our software enables energy providers to enable consumers to share renewable energy. Users of our product can track their energy consumption and buy renewable energy from their neighbors, which makes investing in the energy transition simple and fun! While we primarily serve customers in the DACH region, we are actively expanding into additional markets.

Our team is growing fast and consists of a diverse mix of engineers and business developers who are all motivated to use technology to create a sustainable impact in our society. We are distributed across various European countries, with our office located in Zurich, but primarily working remotely.

Energy-sharing solutions are the next big thing in Europe’s energy market as the European Union is pushing hard for individual climate action. And we are aiming to become Europe’s leading software provider for renewable energy. On that mission, we are looking for motivated and passionate people to join us. To learn more, check out www.exnaton.com.

We are dedicated to fostering diversity and to combat discrimination. We strongly encourage individuals from groups traditionally underrepresented in tech to apply and intend to consider all applications equally regardless of sex, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity. We won't inquire about how you identify or if you've experienced discrimination, but if you want to tell your story, we are all ears.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Project Length: 6 Months initially + extensions

Work Location: 100% remote

Project Language: English

Capacity: 40 hours per week




This role is suited to a Data Scientist who has previous experience modelling ranking algorithms, particularly for optimisation within an e-commerce environment.

Develop an LTR framework module to train models that can optimise custom targets depending on the context.
Implement LTR compatibility with a selection of value added services which are offered across the marketplace.
Optimisation of specific transaction types and marketplace features.
Explore and develop personalisation features with the ranking system to cater to individual user preferences.
Work towards an unbiased LTR system which ensures fairness and diversity.
Manage complexities around compatibility and the balance between ad revenue and user experience.




Ideal Skillset:

Previous experience working on complex ranking models – ideally within e-commerce / search results environment
Deep knowledge in LTR machine learning
Python & relevant Python libraries
NLP
AWS cloud services (desirable)

Title: Data Scientist - Germany (d, f, m)
Description:
Your mission

As a Data Scientist at VR Smart Guide your mission is to develop and implement data science models to drive a data-driven business strategy. Your goals include improving the accuracy of credit risk predictions, creating data-driven solutions for revenue maximization, cost savings, customer satisfaction, and operational efficiency, including the productization of models. You will collaborate with the data platform, product, business, and engineering teams to identify, acquire, and integrate various data sources to inform and refine your model development.

Your role and contribution


Independently develop and deploy new machine learning models.
Develop, refine, and implement machine learning models for creditworthiness prediction and recommendation engines.
Oversee the implementation and maintenance of the infrastructure supporting these models in collaboration with the Data Platform team.
Demonstrate continuous improvement in model accuracy through iterative development and fine-tuning.
Continuously monitor and enhance model performance based on business KPIs.
Improve model accuracy by retraining models and implementing feedback loops.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Data Platform, Product, Business, Engineering) to identify valuable data sources.
Lead the acquisition, integration, and cleaning of diverse data streams to support model development.
Clearly communicate complex data insights and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.



Your profile


Master’s degree in statistics, mathematics, engineering or a similar field. Publishing of relevant articles is a plus
Minimum 3 years of experience as a Data Scientist in financial services, fin-tech, banking, investments, insurance or a related field
Proficiency in Python
Strong empathy for small business owners and a user-centric approach to marketing
Comfortable operating in a quick and in-transition environment
Demonstration of resilience and adaptability in the face of challenges, able to pivot when necessary, and maintain focus on delivering value to customers
Able to make more with less, a mind for automation and simplification
Fluency in English
Willing to travel occasionally to Berlin and/or Eschborn



Our benefits


Educational budget of up to 1.500 Euros per year to enhance your professional knowledge and skills
A space to express yourself - shape this role and your work according to what you think works best for your development and company success
A hybrid work environment - we have locations in Eschborn (near Frankfurt) and Berlin to come together to collaborate. The rest of the time enjoy the flexibility of remote work
An exciting mix of cultures - yes, multiple nationalities coming together to serve small business owners AND a mix of speedy and scrappy startup action as well as an established brand to have our backs
An opportunity to make a difference - in the lives of small business owners and in shaping the way we work, what benefits to establish and how we celebrate each other

Title: ML Engineer (d/f/m)
Description:
About Us

Every year millions of people are either filing their taxes in fear or giving up on their tax refund altogether. We're working on fixing that. Our intuitive app enables anyone, regardless of education or background, to file their taxes with newfound confidence.

Spread across Berlin and Madrid, Team Taxfix is a compassionate group of solution-finders. We speak our minds openly, and with 500+ professionals from 45+ different nationalities, we're rich in ideas and voices. In four years, we've raised over 300 million euros in funding and helped people reclaim more than one billion euros.

Role Overview

You will work closely with product teams to understand their specific product opportunities, and where these can translate them into practical AI/ML solutions that enhance the user experience. Leveraging the tools and resources provided by our ML Platform, you'll focus on integrating ML and AI to build intelligent features within our products. This role offers an exciting opportunity to see your work directly influence the user experience and shape the future of our product landscape.

Key Responsibilities


Collaborate with Product Managers and Application Engineers to define technical requirements and success metrics for ML and AI-powered features.
Translate product concepts into feasible ML and AI solutions, leveraging established approaches and pre-trained models provided by the ML Platform.
Design, develop, and test models within product features, ensuring high accuracy, performance, and explainability.
Implement robust monitoring and evaluation frameworks to track model performance and identify areas for improvement.
Integrate models into production environments, working seamlessly with application developers and DevOps teams.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in relevant domains and communicate their potential impact to teams.
Document technical solutions and participate in knowledge sharing within the organization.


Qualifications


3+ years of experience in applying machine learning to solve real-world product opportunities
Strong understanding of core ML concepts, algorithms, and model development methodologies.
Experience with popular ML libraries and frameworks and familiar working with foundational AI models
Proven ability to translate business requirements into technical specifications and deliver solutions on time and within budget.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Passion for user experience and a strong desire to build products that make a positive impact and enable making tax simple


Bonus Points


Experience with specific ML domains relevant to tax, user journeys and personalization
Understanding of MLOps principles and best practices.


Why Taxfix?


A chance to do meaningful, people-centric work with an international team of passionate professionals.
Holistic wellbeing with free mental health coaching sessions and yoga.
A monthly allowance to spend on an extensive range of services that you can use and rollover as flexibly as you like.
Employee stock options for all employees—because everyone deserves to benefit from the success they help to create.
Dedicated relocation and visa support for those that need it.
30 annual vacation days and flexible working hours.

Entwickeln und Implementieren von Data Science-Anwendungen mit einem crossfunktionalen Team und/ oder externen Dienstleistern

Visualisieren und Analysieren großer Datenmengen, z.B. zur Detektion von Bias oder Daten-Drifts

Fachliches Weiterentwickeln von KI-Anwendungen auf Basis von datenanalytischen Erkenntnissen in Zusammenarbeit mit Fachexpert*innen

Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Analyse großer Datenmengen, insbesondere mit Python bzw. SQL
Erste Erfahrungen in der Entwicklung und Umsetzung von Prädiktionsmodellen und Selektionsverfahren auf Basis von Routinedaten gesammelt
Idealerweise erste Erfahrungen in der Entwicklung von Large Language Modellen (z.B. LoRA, RAG etc.)
Erfahrung im Umgang mit gängigen Data Science-Tools (Git, Jira, Docker, Kubernetes) sind ein Plus


Wir bieten Ihnen


Wir bieten Ihnen eine interessante und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit mit allen Vorteilen einer großen öffentlichen Arbeitgeberin
Die Möglichkeit durch eigene Ideen die digitale Transformation der DRV Bund mitzugestalten
Vielfältige Projekte wie KIRA, in dem eine KI-basierte Anwendung für unseren Betriebsprüfdienst entwickelt wird

Eine hervorragende Aussicht aus dem 16. Stock des Silberturms über den Dächern Berlins am Hohenzollerndamm; mindestens ein Tag Präsenz pro Woche
Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf durch flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle sowie der Möglichkeit der Arbeit im Homeoffice

Title: Junior Data Scientist (m/w/d) – Risikomodelle
Description:
Die Sparkassen Rating und Risikosysteme (SR) ist der zentrale Dienstleister für Verfahren des Risiko­manage­ments in der Sparkassen-Finanzgruppe. Wir unterstützen die Institute mit Standardlösungen in den Bereichen der Risiko­messung und -steuerung, der regulatorischen Banksteuerung sowie im Vertrieb mit Data-Analytics-Lösungen. Gemeinsam mit unseren Partnern bieten wir den Instituten, von der Konzeption der Verfahren, über deren Weiterentwicklung, IT-Umsetzung und Umsetzungsunterstützung, zentrale und standardisierte Lösungen an.

Junior Data Scientist (m/w/d) – Risikomodelle

Wir suchen ständig qualifizierte Unterstützung

Aufgaben


Mitarbeit an Gremien- oder Kundenprojekten im Umfeld der Risikobewertung (z. B. Rating, Scoring, Verlustschätzung / LGD, makroökonomische Zeitreihenmodelle, IFRS9)
Konzeption, Parameterschätzung, Modellpflege und Validierung unter Berücksichtigung regulatorischer Vorgaben und betriebswirtschaftlicher Anforderungen unserer Kunden
Erstellung von Fach- / DV-Konzepten, Schnitt­stellenspezifikationen und Datenmodellierung
Begleitung der technischen Implementierung und IT-Testing
Beratung und Ergebnispräsentation bei unseren Kunden und in Fach- / Expertenkreisen


Profil


Abgeschlossenes Studium (ggf. Promotion) im Bereich Wirtschafts­wissenschaften, Informatik, Mathematik, Physik oder vergleichbares quantitatives Studium
Gute Kenntnisse in der anwendungsorientierten Statistik, Finanzmathematik oder dem Risiko­management
Idealerweise erste Erfahrungen:
in der praktischen Anwendung und Nutzung statistischer Methoden
mit Machine-Learning-Algorithmen oder numerischer Optimierung (z. B. Regressionsverfahren, Random Forests, neuronale Netze)
im Umgang mit SQL und in einem anderen Datenbankmanagementsystem
mit einem Analysetool (z. B. R, SAS, KNIME, SPSS, Matlab) oder gängigen Programmiersprachen (z. B. Python, Java)
im Umfeld von Banken, Beratungs-, Wirtschaftsprüfungs- oder Versicherungs­gesellschaft
Ausgeprägtes teamorientiertes Handeln mit einem Schuss Humor
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift auf C1-Niveau

Wir bieten


Eine unbefristete Tätigkeit in einem hoch versierten Arbeitsumfeld mit anspruchsvollen Aufgaben und einem attraktiven Vergütungspaket
30 Tage Urlaub + 2 Bankfeiertage und zusätzlichen Sonderurlaub für besondere Anlässe
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge und vermögens­wirksame Leistungen
Individuelle interne | externe Weiterbildung über unsere Akademie
Flexible Arbeitszeiten mit Gleitzeit und Option zum mobilen Arbeiten für eine echte Work-Life-Balance
Betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement
Zuzahlung zum Jobticket und Essensgutscheine
Dienstrad-Leasing (JobRad) als zusätzliches Mobilitätsangebot
Kostenfreie Girokontoführung inkl. Visa Card Gold bei der Berliner Sparkasse
Interne Veranstaltungen: Meet-Ups, Afterworks, Sommer- und Weihnachtsfeste
Zentraler und moderner Arbeitsplatz


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

Visualize and document your work

You have 4+ years of experience working with machine learning models
You have 2+ years of experience working with marketing-related challenges and data

At Futurae, we are on a mission to revolutionize cybersecurity by providing businesses and their users with seamless authentication and transaction confirmation solutions. Our customer-centric approach emphasizes security, usability, and innovation. We have a diverse team of industry leaders who work tirelessly to solve tough challenges in online authentication and transaction signing.

We are currently seeking a talented and ambitious Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our team and lead our fraud detection efforts. In this role, you will have the opportunity to shape the future of cybersecurity while creating outstanding user experiences. You will work closely with our product management and technical teams to design, build, and improve our cutting-edge authentication solution.

Responsibilities:


Develop and optimize machine learning models as part of our authentication solution
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define feature specifications and ensure high-quality delivery
Write robust and maintainable code in languages such as Python or Go
Participate in the entire development cycle of our software, following our Agile development process
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in machine learning and cybersecurity

Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, with a focus on cybersecurity
Strong knowledge of machine learning models and algorithms
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or Go
Experience with data science libraries and tools, such as Pandas, NumPy, and SciPy
Understanding of security concepts and best practices
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Strong communication and collaboration abilities
Experience with Agile development methodologies


If you are passionate about machine learning, cybersecurity, and want to be part of a dynamic and friendly team, we would love to hear from you!

Benefits

Why Futurae

Join a young, international, and fast-paced Cybersecurity company with experienced industry leaders


Futurae Stock Options
Yearly personal learning & development budget
Apple Laptop and equipment for work purposes
Ability to work remotely (European time zones only)
Work at the forefront of an inspiring, dynamic tech company in the B2B space in the area of end-user authentication and transaction confirmation
Be part of our friendly, knowledge-sharing, entrepreneurial culture and flat hierarchy, where we value open and respectful communication, collaboration and an attitude that gets things done for our customers
Work in a role that gives you responsibility and independence
Access to coaching, ongoing professional development and training, mentorship and our culture of continuous learning

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d) Mathematical Optimization

Entwickeln, was morgen wichtig ist.

Wir freuen uns darüber, wenn du dein Talent bei uns einbringst!

Verändere mit uns die Welt von morgen.


Digital Factory: Du identifizierst Potentiale zur Automatisierung und Optimierung gemeinsam mit Kollegen und Kolleginnen aus den Fachbereichen Manufacturing, Finance und dem Supply Chain Management/ Logistik, bei denen der Einsatz von Data Science einen Mehrwert für unser Geschäft darstellt.
Mathematische Optimierung: Dein Fokus liegt auf der Entwicklung und Implementierung mathematischer Optimierungsmodelle und Heuristiken für spezielle logistische Fragstellungen.
Data Analysis und Digitale Transformation: Du analysierst und interpretierst Daten aus unserer innovativen Dateninfrastruktur zu möglichen Prozess-, Produkt- oder Qualitätsverbesserungen und bist ein aktiver Bestandteil der digitalen Transformation für unsere Fertigungsstandorte.
Künstliche Intelligenz (KI): Du stellst die Funktionsfähigkeit deiner Modelle in der Praxis unter Beweis, um unsere Geschäftsabläufe zu optimieren.
Web-Applikationen/Cloud Computing: Du entwickelst Web-Applikationen zu deinen Use-Cases in unserer Cloud-Umgebung und verbesserst diese kontinuierlich gemeinsam mit uns weiter.
Project Lead und Cross-Functional Teams: Du verantwortest die erfolgreiche Entwicklung und Implementierung deiner Use Cases mit cross-funktionalen, agilen Fachabteilungs- und IT-Teams, um skalierbare Erfolgsgeschichten zu liefern.


Dein Profil für "Zukunft möglich machen".


Du besitzt einen fachlich relevanten Bachelorabschluss oder höher im Bereich (Wirtschafts-)Ingenieurwesen, (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, (Wirtschafts-)Mathematik oder einer verwanden Fachrichtung.
Du bringst bereits mehrjährig Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Science und/oder Computer Science mit, vorzugsweise im industriellen Fertigungsumfeld.
Du zeichnest Dich durch gute Kenntnisse in C#, Python und SQL aus.
Du bist mit der mathematischen Modellierung (Operations-Research) von logistischen Fragestellungen und den damit gängigen Lösungsverfahren vertraut und bringst idealerweise Erfahrung im Bereich Machine Learning und Deep Learning mit.
Du kannst Erfahrungen und Technologiekenntnisse im Cloud-Computing Bereich, wie z.B. mit Microsoft Azure, AWS oder GCP vorweisen.
Du besitzt die Fähigkeit, komplexe Fragestellungen zu erfassen, detailliert zu analysieren und zu modellieren sowie die gewonnenen Erkenntnisse einem nicht-technischen Publikum verständlich zu präsentieren.
Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse runden dein Profil ab.


Was wir bieten.


Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket
Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für deine berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung
Ein Arbeitsumfeld, in dem du dich mit deiner ganzen Persönlichkeit einbringen kannst und dich als Teil von Siemens fühlst
30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für dich und deine Familie ermöglichen
Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende
Vielfältige Gesundheitsangebote
Barrierefreie Standorte
Und viele weitere Benefits hier


Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie persönliche Präferenzen.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.

We’re looking for a talented Senior Data Scientist to come aboard and be part of Data Applications built on Snowflake. In this role, you will work closely with our Product and Engineering teams to uncover insights about how providers built data apps and customers use Snowflake and applications, helping to inform Product’s decision making and focus Engineering efforts. You will also work on long-running analytical initiatives marked by greater complexity and less structure that will yield substantial product enhancements. This is a strategic, high-impact role that will help shape the future of Snowflake products and services.

AS A SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST AT SNOWFLAKE YOU WILL:


Drive high impactful initiatives for the global data application architecture and provide foundation for all critical telemetry and events to track data apps , its usage & consumption patterns
Innovate and build data platforms to store, analyze sleuth through large amounts of data to uncover feature-usage patterns, subtle issues with the system, potential performance enhancements, and areas to improve user experience.
Influence and collaborate closely with Engineers and Product Managers and executives to inform product decision making with data and to identify opportunities to create more value for our customers.
Build framework and foundational high quality data pipelines , inform engineering for relevant instrumentation of telemetry events and architect the right data model for the product.
Build native apps , dashboards/apps & analytical framework to help Engineering and Product Managers monitor performance and availability of our system.
Answer questions from the executive team for board reporting, publications, and industry reports.
Think creatively to find optimal solutions to our complex, often unstructured problems.



OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:


MS/Ph.D. in quantitative discipline (Math, Statistics, Operations Research, Economics, Engineering, or CS)
Expert-level experience working with SQL and relational data (8+ years on a regular basis).
8+ years of experience with Python, including scikit-learn, numpy, and pandas.
Expert in working with large-scale machine generated data (e.g., log, application, or customer-usage data).
Heavy fluency with MPP databases, such as Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, Vertica, etc.
Data storytelling , analysis & learnings to business leaders and technical stakeholders.
The ability to thrive in a dynamic environment. That means being flexible and willing to jump in and do whatever it takes to be successful.
Must have prior experience in data application , apps , app store & marketplace.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Summary of the role:

To build a world-class engineering team, we are looking for an AI Engineer to lead our efforts around the analysis and evaluation of biomedical data by leveraging state of the art (L)LMs and using cutting-edge machine learning methods.




✨ Why Flinn?

We are building a truly exceptional culture: While many companies claim to have a great culture, we invite you to discover what truly sets ours apart. Visit our career page, speak with our team, listen to our founders’ podcast, or experience our culture first-hand during the interview process.
Make a Meaningful Impact: Your work at Flinn contributes directly to solutions that improve people’s health and lives by making high-quality health products accessible for everyone.
Experienced, well-funded, highly professional: As well-funded startup veterans, we know how to sustain long-term business health and success, ensuring an environment for continuous personal growth.




🚀 Your contributions to our journey:

Being involved in the setup of our tech stack and AI / data pipelines.
Developing models for analysis and classification of biomedical data, pattern recognition and anomalies detection.
Collaborating with the tech team to bring the developed / trained models into production and supporting the whole end-to-end process.
Contributing to defining and shaping our data and AI product roadmap.




💯 What you need to be successful:

Experience in the complete end-to-end process and life cycle of model development: From data acquisition and preparation to the deployment and go-live phase.
Experience in NLP and the fields of topic modeling, document classification, named entity recognition and recommender systems.
Expert-level experience in working with transformer-based large language models (BERT, GPT, Llama, etc.), this includes:
Advanced knowledge of prompt engineering techniques, e.g. zero / few shot classification, Chain-Of-Thought, etc.
Experience in fine-tuning open-source language models on both labelled (supervised) and unlabelled (unsupervised) domain-specific data using various techniques like LoRa and PEFT / ReFT.
Experience in validating, evaluating and benchmarking LLM performance on specific task
Experience with LangChain is a plus.
Good level of proficiency in Python and the common data science tool kit: NumPy, pandas, scikit-learn, etc. Extensive experience in at least one of the following Machine Learning frameworks: PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX.
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and methodologies, with the ability to apply them effectively in data analysis and model development.
Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, ETL and data pipelines is a plus.
Experience with cloud computing (AWS, GCP, Azure) and IaC is a plus.

Title: AI/ML and MLOps Field Engineer
Description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing.

We are hiring an AI/ML and MLOps Field Engineer to help global companies embrace AI in their business, using the latest open source capabilities on public and private cloud infrastructure, Linux and Kubernetes. Our team applies expert insights to real-world customer problems, enabling the enterprise adoption of Ubuntu, Kubeflow, MLFlow, Feast, DVC and related analytics, machine learning and data technologies. We are working to create the world's best open source data platform, covering traditional SQL databases and today's NoSQL data stores, as well as the machinery which turns data into insights and executable models.

The people who love this role are software engineers who enjoy customer conversations and solving customer problems during the presales cycle. They are are developers who like to solve customer problems through architecture, presentations and training. Ubuntu is used by pretty much every enterprise in the world, in every industry. This is a fantastic opportunity to learn about the open source technology landscape and develop your business technology insights. You will see first hand in various industries how Linux - and Ubuntu in particular - is shaping innovation and changing the world for the better.

This role is particularly suited to candidates with a technical background who are business minded and driven by commercial success. This role is on our global Field Engineering team and will work closely with enterprise sales leads. We are specifically looking for people interested in solving the most difficult problems in modern data architectures. Training LLMs on multiple K8s clusters deployed on a hybrid cloud infrastructure with GPU sharing across multiple teams? Processing 10M events in real time for financial transactions? Object detection on 10k parallel 4K video streams? These are the problems we solve day to day.

Location: Most of our colleagues work from home. We are growing teams in EMEA, Americas and APAC time zones, so can accommodate candidates from almost any country.

What your day will look like

The global Field Engineering team members are Linux and cloud solutions architects for our customers, designing private and public cloud solutions fitting their workload needs. They are the cloud consultants who work hands-on with the technologies by deploying, testing and handing over the solution to our support or managed services team at the end of a project. They are also software engineers who use Python to develop Kubernetes operators and Linux open source infrastructure-as-code.


Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications
Architect cloud infrastructure solutions like Kubernetes, Kubeflow, OpenStack, and Spark
Deliver solutions either on-premise or in public cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
Collect customer business requirements and advise them on Ubuntu and relevant open source applications
Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values
Deliver presentations and demonstrations of Ubuntu Pro and AI/ML capabilities to prospective and current clients
Liaise with product teams to give them feedback on requirements to influence roadmap
Work collaboratively with your sales team to reach our common targets
Global travel up to 25% of time for internal and external events and 25% to customer meetings


What we are looking for in you


Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
Experience in data engineering, MLOps, or big data solutions deployment
Experience with a relevant programming language, like Python, R, or Rust.
Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
Demonstrated personal interest in continuous learning and development
Practical knowledge of Linux, virtualisation, containers and networking
Business-minded technology thinker and problem solver
Knowledge of cloud computing concepts & leaders, such as Kubernetes, AWS, Azure, GCP
Interest in large-scale enterprise open source - private clouds, machine learning and AI, data and analytics
Intermediate level Python programming skills
Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives
The work ethic and confidence to shine alongside motivated colleagues
Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
A dynamic person who loves to jump in new projects and interact with people
Appreciative of diversity, polite and effective in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation
Thoughtfulness and self-motivation
Result-oriented, with a personal drive to follow up and meet commitments
Ability to travel internationally, for company events up to two weeks long, and customer or industry meetings


What you'll learn


Architect and deploy AI/ML infrastructures, data processing pipelines and multi-cluster distributed training
Wide range of open source applications and skills
Work directly with customers in a range of different businesses
Real-life and hands-on exposure to a wide range of emerging technologies and tools


What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.


Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Python Developer (m/f/d)
Description:
WHITEvoid is an art and design studio. Our work spans a wide range of cutting-edge projects and scales. From architecture, interiors, and light installations to interactive exhibits and custom-made applications, our architectonic designs realize complex, unique ideas and adorn clubs, shops, exhibitions, shows, and more worldwide.




Our team comprises specialists in architecture, product design, event technology, and mechanical, electronics, and software engineering. Driven by technology, innovation, and experimentation, we dare to think big and push the boundaries of complexity and beauty in every project.




Our house brand KINETIC LIGHTS is the leading specialist in kinetic lighting. For more than fifteen years our designs and products have earned awards and worldwide recognition for delivering professionally engineered lighting equipment.







YOUR TASKS:

Develop and maintain our in-house control software for the KINETIC LIGHTS event automation system
Adapt and extend the Python-based backend of the software
Integrate the backend with UI components built in TouchDesigner
Manage data structures in Python
Work closely with our TouchDesigner development team, who focus more on content programming, show-delivery, UI, and frontend development
Collaborate with firmware and hardware engineers on testing KINETIC LIGHTS products
Cooperate with our manufacturing and technical planning teams
Provide off-site support for ongoing projects
Create and maintain technical documentation







YOU BRING:

Strong proficiency in Python programming with experience in application building, software architecture, and UI frameworks
Understanding of general object-oriented programming principles and design patterns
At least a basic familiarity with C++ programming
Proficiency in vector and matrix mathematic, e.g. transformations of coordinate spaces
Experience with network protocols, e.g. UDP, TCP, and OSC
Solid understanding of core computer graphics concepts and 3D pipelines
Experience using git for version control of software development projects
Adaptability to a dynamic project environment
A willingness to learn new tools, technologies, and concepts, especially TouchDesigner
A strong team player mentality with a proactive attitude and a willingness to share knowledge and support colleagues
Excellent communication skills in English. You do not need to speak German for this role!







WE OFFER:

Exceptional, challenging and unique international projects
Participation in the ongoing establishment of DARK MATTER, a new location for art, technology and events
A highly motivated, international team and a friendly, open-minded working environment - we stand for openness and diversity!
Working independently, flat hierarchies and the opportunity to contribute your own ideas
Substantial discount on Urban Sports Club memberships
Free German lessons online or at a centrally located school
A bike leasing scheme with tax benefits, insurance, maintenance, and end of lease options
Guest list allowance for our permanent exhibition and temporary events
Delicious coffee and other drinks and snacks for free
Team events, such as BBQs, summer parties and a Christmas party
A modern studio right on the Spree in East Berlin with great leisure activities nearby







HOW TO APPLY:

Please send us your digital application including CV, salary expectations and preferred start date by email to jobs@whitevoid.com
